etymologies: early 17th century: from French, from Arabic kuskus, from kaskasa ‘to pound’, probably of Berber origin

definitions: a type of North African semolina in granules made from crushed durum wheat.
shortDefinitions: type of North African semolina in granules made from crushed durum wheat

definitions: a spicy dish made by steaming or soaking couscous and adding meat, vegetables, or fruit.
shortDefinitions: spicy dish made by steaming or soaking couscous and adding meat or fruit
